title: Thunderbird 115 has no junk removal tool
content:
I am speechless. Thunderbird has made the biggest mistake in all my time in FOSS since 2008. I don't post this because I enjoy it; I've handed out Linux distros at Software Freedom Day. But there comes a point when I have a right to be unhappy even with a free tool.

The previous version of Thunderbird had a button under tools; I could delete all junk emails in one click. THIS IS MY MAIN REASON TO USE THUNDER BIRD. I run a business email and I get so much spam.

But now that tool is gone in Supernova. I am left to deleting ONE junk email at a time which would take hours? Not to mention the safety aspects of this; I need to clean my emails so that my business partner who uses the computer doesn't fall for a scam.

PLEASE PLEASE put this delete junk button under Tools back in. If not I have no choice but to look for a different email client. I can put in my own email sever settings. Fine. I am not asking for an email client that molly coddles me. But this change is ridiculous.

I can not under stand why Supernova has done this.
creator: secretelf77

content:

Simply anyone know how to sort this (I am mildly technical but not programmer standard) and is this a known issue Mozilla are likely to fix or is it an issue at my email providers end? Thanks

title: Thunderbird (102 & 115) for Windows downloads same mail again on dual boot windows 10 and Linux (Ubuntu & Mageia)
content:
For almost twenty years I have been using Thunderbird, and for more than twenty years I have been using Linux as my main Operating System, also for work, for which however I often have to use Windows and other Microsoft software, reason why I use laptops in dual-boot with the two OS; for this reason, as soon as possible I shared the installation between the two OS, always having available in my mail software all the messages received and sent. This system always worked well, even when migrating profiles from one computer to another, with the associated changes to the operating systems; until, at some point corresponding to Thunderbird version 102, when starting Thunderbird from Windows, it started downloading all the thousands of messages from the various mail servers I use that had already been downloaded to the local computer (they are all POP accounts); This behaviour did not repeat itself when I was only using Windows and used Thunderbird from that OS for several days. However, when I accessed mail from the Linux OS (Ubuntu and Mageia), everything worked fine here, but when I go back to Windows after using Thunderbird from the Linux OS, Thunderbird starts downloading all the mail that had already been downloaded from all the servers.

I have tried some suggestions for similar problems: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1310598 https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1392106 However, by deleting the popstate.dat file or creating a new profile, the problem reoccurs regularly, no antivirus is active, the system is not infected by viruses.

The behaviour of Thunderbird is as follows 1) Thunderbird on Linux OS works regularly and only downloads new messages if there are any (no duplicates). 2) Thunderbird on Windows 10, however, if Thunderbird on Linux OS has retrieved messages from a particular mail server since the last time it was started, it will retrieve all the messages on that server again; if there have been no changes Thunderbird does not download anything correctly.

I tried looking at the popstate.dat files after downloading messages from Windows and Linux and I also noticed differences between the file when updated by Thunderbird on Windows or on Linux after downloading messages from the server. Normally, when you set up a new profile in Thunderbird, the messages are downloaded from the server and the popstate.dat file is generated and then updated, which is made up of a series of lines, each corresponding to a different message (each line is made up of a letter (in my case "k", because I leave the messages on the server), a series of numbers or characters (UIDL code), a series of numbers that I don't know what they correspond to (sometimes they are the same for some messages with a different progressive UIDL), the lines are reported in the file by arranging the messages in progressive order of UIDL code. In my case, when I use Thunderbird on Linux OS, the popstate.dat file is generated according to this behaviour and when it inherits the updated popstate.dat file from Windows, it keeps the third set of number codes of the messages already downloaded and continues to insert the lines with the new messages. Thunderbird on Windows, on the other hand, downloads all the messages again and generates a popstate.dat file in which the first letter and the UIDL code of each line remain the same, but the third set of numbers changes; the lines are also generated in the progressive order of the UIDL, except for one that is moved from a certain point in the order to the end of the list, without respecting the numerical order of the UIDL; the third set of numbers generated in this way also "groups" the messages in a different way from what was done before. The attached image shows the contents of the popstate.dat file in four cases described above: the first is generated by Thunderbird on Linux, the second is the same as updated by Thunderbird on Windows, the third is the same file as updated by Thunderbird on Linux after new messages arrive, the fourth is still the same file as updated by Thunderbird on Windows.
creator: FC-Lin-Moz

title: Egyesített mappákból hiányzó postafiók
content:
Ha a "Minden mappa" ÉS "Egyesített mappák" mindkettő be van jelölve, akkor ott van az EBC jelű postafiók. Ha a "Minden mappa"-t kikapcsolom, eltűnik a "Beérkezett üzenetek"-ből az EBC postafiók. Pedig fontos lenne az összes postafiók Beérkezett üzeneteit egyszerre látni. Most külön a Kedvencekbe tettem, hogy legalább ott legyen fölül a képernyőn.

Az EBC mappa (IMAP) beállításai megegyeznek más postafiókok beállításaival.

Már eltávolítottam, majd újra telepítettem a fiókot, nem működik.

A TB verzióm 115.3.1 (64 bites) Az előző verzióban ez nem volt probléma.

Köszönöm. Gábor

title: There is no way to see the actual mail address from which an E-Mail was sent in the list view without opening the E-Mail
content:
I cannot comprehend how in the general list view of all mails there is no addable column "From Address" or similar to add a column that just shows the actual E-Mail-address from which that mail was sent.

It is only possible to show the display name of the Correspondent. But if someone changes that (like what is very usual in malicious spam mails) you can just see, for example "Netflix" and only when manually opening that mail you can see that it was actually sent from "aeback@maliciousspam.com.fr".

This is a security risk as by opening any mail (without setting "View -> Message Body as -> only text") information can be leaked to any third party with or without malicious intent.

There have been addons that tried to add this feature (which undoubtedly should be present in any basic E-Mail client), but they since have been killed off by the update to Thunderbird 115.

I really don't understand the rationale of not adding such a column. The work needed for that would be minuscule for such an essential security feature. Please tell me that I just haven't found it yet.
creator: olf.mombach

title: Can't send to or from a specific address
content:
Hi,

Long time enjoyer of mozilla software here. Recently I've run into a very strange issue. It appears as if an email address in Thunderbird is blocked somehow. Whenever I try to send to, or send from this email address, it gives an error. See examples below.

Please note, if I use a different account to send the email, there's no problems. If I use webmail to do the same thing, no problems If I use an app on my phone to do the same thing, no problems. So I am pretty sure the issue is in Thunderbird.

Also note this is a 'catch all' account - so the account is configured to be able to send from any address within the same domain, through a single configured identity. Any other addresses work fine. There's just one specific address that gives the problem.

I know I can easily save myself some headaches and change the email address, but I don't like having strange problems and want to figure out what is wrong. If anyone has any idea what could be going on or if you need more information, let me know.

Example error when sending from the address:

Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: Verification failed for <someaddress@domain.com> Sender verify failed. Please check the message recipient "someaddress@domain.com" and try again.

Example error when sending to the address: Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: No such recipient here. Please check the message recipient "someaddress@domain.com" and try again

creator: HaraldKi

title: Como criar uma agenda na rede local usando um servidor de arquivo compartilhado?
content:
Olá, trabalho numa empresa de pequeno porte (6 funcionários) e utilizamos o Mozilla Thunderbird como cliente de email. Estou interessado em criar uma agenda na rede para podermos registrar algumas tarefas.

Essa artigo (https://support.mozilla.org/pt-BR/kb/crie-novas-agendas) mostra que da pra criar uma agenda na rede no sistema de arquivos local ou de rede compartilhada. Mas já testei um monte de combinação nos campos Nome de Usuário e Localização mas sem êxito.

A rede aqui da empresa e esse servidor de arquivo funciona do seguinte modo: - Temos uma maquina que em um HD fica instalado o Windows Server com AD-DS e outro HD tem as pastas que ficam compartilhadas na rede.

- Em cada maquina dos funcionários, eu mapeio uma unidade para exibir os arquivos deste HD que fica no Windows Server.

Eu pensei em salvar o arquivo da agenda nesse HD compartilhado na rede e configurar a agenda no thunderbird de cada usuario.

The neighboring email to the one dragged inherits the higlighted status but it is greyed out. This helps with finding my spot in th eInbox pane but it is an interruption in flow.

I am grateful for Thunderbird.

title: Message Body disappeared on 115.3.1 -- Can only see headers on 1 of 2 accounts. The other account is fine. POP & viridio is the email provider. Same problem happened in 102 but reversed (account 2 was fine, account 1 is not)
content:
Hi,

My Thunderbird auto updated this afternoon to 115.3.1 . Now I am only seeing message headers. The body of the messages has disappeared. I'm not seeing anything on the bottom half of the screen, not even the message tool bar where you can delete, reply, etc..

Strangely -- the very same thing happened to me six months back with a secondary account, but my primary account was unaffected. So I was using the email interface with one email address (same domain name) which worked fine, while the secondary one only showed headers, and not the actual messages.

NOW-- after this download, the secondary email address account is showing both the headers and the messages, while my primary account is only showing the headers.

PLEASE HELP. Posted here six months ago for the previous time but never got any solution to the problem then. Just lived with it, as it was a secondary email address, but I will have to leave Thunderbird if I can't get the primary address showing actual messages soon.

Thanks in advance for your help!

Zach

title: View Source of an Email Without Opening It
content:

I've mentioned before, too, that sometime back Thunderbird removed the distinction between which emails were read and which weren't. I've been hoping that function would come back, but so far it is still elusive, just like View Source.

Another thing that is frustrating is the removal of "File". Yes, I do not like this new update. As far as I'm concerned it is far from intuitive and clumsy. I may have to find another email client to replace the one I have used forever. Sad.

But, please, can someone point me to where I can restore the View contents that include View/Source at the bottom? Am I going to have to poke around in the config to see if it's hidden there now?

Thanks!

"Not the bunny"

title: Help needed troubleshooting automatic junk filter
content:
I've been using Thunderbird for years and love it! I have multiple email addresses, but I'm having problems for a good year or so with one of my gmail accounts that gets a lot of junk mail. Gmail filters suspected junk mail and places it in a folder called spam. I know how to use webmail and mark an email as not spam. I also know how to setup a filter that says, Never send to spam. Despite taking these steps, I have messages that within a minute of marking "not spam", end up moving right back to the spam folder. I've been trying everything I can think of and then I found under settings that I could uncheck Show in IMAP for the Spam folder and it wouldn't appear in Thunderbird. <see image attached> Once I did that, I could mark a message as "not spam" or just move back to my inbox through webmail and it will now stay in the inbox. But that means I can't view the spam folder through Thunderbird, which isn't ideal.

So I need help determining what is causing the emails to move from the Inbox to Spam when IMAP is turned on for the Spam folder and I open Thunderbird so that I can hopefully stop Thunderbird from moving them. I've tried unchecking adaptive junk mail, SpamAssassin, and Move new junk messages. <see images attached>

What can I do and where can I look to determine what is causing the emails to move when Spam is turned on in IMAP?

Thanks in advance for your help, Elspeth Coats
creator: webcoats

title: Složka pro stahování aktualizací
content: Jak mohu změnit složku, kterou používá Thunderbird pro stahování aktualizací? Díky za odpověď.
creator: mh2023

title: Impostazioni visualizzazione e.mail
content: Buongiorno dopo aver aggiornato Thunderbird la posta in arrivo è diventata stretta come posso allargare la distanza tra un e-mail e l'altra? Grazie
creator: leopard2701

title: Scrolling email list with up and down arrows.
content: When scrolling through emails each day, I have always used my left hand on the mouse and my right hand on keyboard up and down arrows. This way, when I get to an email to delete or junk (most of 'em these days!) I simply use the mouse to click delete/junk/move, whatever it needs, then continue to scroll with the Down arrow. It seems with new Supernova that this is no longer possible. If an email is highlighted then I can arrow scroll as usual but as soon as I,say, delete one then I loose the highlight bar (it's gone with the deleted email) and the arrows no longer work until I use the mouse to highlight another email. Am I missing something here or has this characteristic been removed? (hope I've described this clearly) Thanks Chris
creator: chris119

title: Funzione rimossa o solo nascosta?
content:
Buongiorno, una funzione che trovo/trovavo veramente utile era quella di poter istantaneamente vedere la cronistoria di una conversazione, con un solo click. Purtroppo non ricordo più il nome di tale funzione e non riesco a capire se è 1)stata rimossa con il nuovo Supernova 2)nascosta/spostata da qualche parte e che non riesco a trovare.

Una volta selezionata una email, trovavo questa funzione sopra il pannello di destra (quello dove si apre l'anteprima dell'email stessa) dove ci sono anche i pulsanti Rispondi, Rispondi a tutti, Inoltra, Archivia etc. L'ultimo è "Altro" e dal menu a tendina, non ricordo se era la prima funzione o tra le prime funzioni, potevo cliccare e mi si apriva la finestra con l'esploso della conversazione, senza dover fare mille ricerche.

C'è nessuno che mi può aiutare a capire come riavere tale funzione senza la quale non so se riuscirò più a vivere :( Grazie Martin
creator: m4rtinlevelling

title: Ztráta kontaktů po aktualizaci
content: Zdravím, po poslední atualizaci Thunedbirdu (115.3.1. 64bitů) jsem zjistil, že se mi ztratily všechny kontakty. Je nějaká možnost jak je obnovit? Děkuji Jenda
creator: ales.safarik
